'''''Boletus regineus''''', commonly known as the '''queen bolete''',<ref name=cfreg/> is an [[edible mushroom|edible]] and highly regarded [[fungus]] of the genus ''[[Boletus]]'' that inhabits southwestern [[North America]]. It was considered a variant of the similarly edible ''[[Boletus edulis|B. edulis]]'' for many years until declared a unique species in 2008.<ref name="Arora 2008"/>  [[Phylogenetics|Phylogenetic]] analysis has shown ''B. regineus'' as a member of a [[clade]], or closely related group, with ''[[Boletus subcaerulescens|B. subcaerulescens]]'', ''[[Gastroboletus subalpinus]]'', ''[[Boletus pinophilus|B. pinophilus]]'', ''[[Boletus fibrillosus|B. fibrillosus]]'', and ''[[Boletus rex-veris|B. rex-veris]]''.<ref name=dent10/>
